sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A Legacie left to Protestants, containing eighteen controversies, viz. 1. Of the Holy Scriptures. 2. Of Christs Catholick Church, &c. 3. Of the Bishop and Church of Rome, 4. Of traditions needfull, &c. Bayly, Thomas, d. 1657?, T. B.
[6], 200 p.
s.n.], Dowa, [i.e. Douai : Printed 1654.
Dedication signed: T.B. Attributed to Thomas Bayly, although the dedication mentions that the work was written by a learned man "dead nine years since". Annotation on Thomason copy: "27 July 1655."; the 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[6], 200 p.
s.n.], Dowa, [i.e. Douai : Printed 1654.
Dedication signed: T.B. Attributed to Thomas Bayly, although the dedication mentions that the work was written by a learned man "dead nine years since". Annotation on Thomason copy: "27 July 1655."; the 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
